dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S2398 RS: Kay Hagan Tick Reauthorization Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Collins (for herself, Ms. Smith, Mr. King, Mrs. Gillibrand, Ms. Klobuchar, Mr. Hawley, Mr. Schumer, Mrs. Shaheen, Mr. Marshall, Ms. Hassan, Mr. McCormick, Mrs. Capito, Mr. Banks, Mr. Welch, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Hickenlooper, and Mr. Fetterman) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions
Reported by Mr. Cassidy, with an amendment
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To reauthorize the Kay Hagan Tick Act, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Kay Hagan Tick Reauthorization Act.

subsection.header: National strategy and regional centers of excellence in vector-Borne disease
subsection.text: Section 317U of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 247b–23) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking the Tick-Borne Disease Working Group established under section 2062 of the 21st Century Cures Act (42 U.S.C. 284s) and other individuals, as appropriate and inserting appropriate individuals; and
in subsection (f), by striking 2021 through 2025 and inserting 2026 through 2030.

subsection.header: Enhanced support To assist health departments in addressing vector-Borne diseases
subsection.text: Section 2822(c) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300hh–32(c)) is amended by striking 2021 through 2025 and inserting 2026 through 2030.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Kay Hagan Tick Reauthorization Act.

subsection.header: National strategy and regional centers of excellence in vector-borne diseases
subsection.text: Section 317U of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 247b–23) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking the Tick-Borne Disease Working Group established under section 2062 of the 21st Century Cures Act (42 U.S.C. 284s) and other individuals, as appropriate and inserting appropriate individuals;
in subsection (c), by striking in coordination with and inserting acting through; and
in subsection (f), by striking 2021 through 2025 and inserting 2026 through 2030.

subsection.header: Enhanced support to assist health departments in addressing vector-borne diseases
subsection.text: Section 2822(c) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300hh–32(c)) is amended by striking 2021 through 2025 and inserting 2026 through 2030.
